comments.content: Key-based authentication is going to be used.

discussion.content: If we disable password authentication, what should we use for authentication?
This is definitely the: A. The analyst has discovered a False Positive, and the status code is incorrect providing an OK message.

comments.content: Agreed. I selected B simply due to path=/. I looked at the 200 as letting you know there was a successful connection to the mail server. I would think there would be a 404 after being unable to retrieve the document.

discussion.content: HTTP 200 means OK - request has succeeded. So nothing in the choices are worded correctly lol
Answer B. 200 informational message connection good. Notice the connection is closed by access control list.

use 0 for FALSE and 1 for TRUE.... If output exists prior to calling this function, setcookie() will fail and return FALSE. If setcookie() successfully runs, it will return TRUE. This does not indicate whether the user accepted the cookie. If set to '/', the cookie will be available within the entire domain. https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.setcookie.php.
If a file existed - path=/ should have returned a document - it did not. So, NO FILE was found. 
STATUS CODE: 200 - which is correct - it connected and found nothing.
A 200 code means ok. A 403 means forbidden. Not sure if B is the correct answer

choices.D: The analyst has discovered a False Positive, and the status code is incorrect providing a server error message.
choices.A: The analyst has discovered a False Positive, and the status code is incorrect providing an OK message.
choices.B: The analyst has discovered a True Positive, and the status code is correct providing a file not found error message.
choices.C: The analyst has discovered a True Positive, and the status code is incorrect providing a forbidden message.

discussion.content: this question is on the exam. thank you
10.0 should be critical and not high

choices.A: Remediate by going to the web config file, searching for the enforce HTTP validation setting, and manually updating to the correct setting.
choices.D: Ensure HTTP validation is enabled by rebooting the server.
choices.B: Accept this risk for now because this is a "high" severity, but testing will require more than the four days available, and the system ATO needs to be competed.
choices.C: Ignore it. This is false positive, and the organization needs to focus its efforts on other findings.

choices.D: Install a WAF in front of the application server.

discussion.content: Either review the firewall logs or the syslogs. Performing fuzzing without any kind of log review is wrong.

comments.content: Right, syslogs are going to help show if devices/connections went down, etc.
syslogs is a better answer. Firewall logs don't offer much value when looking at why the users are locking out frequently.

discussion.content: This question is on the exam.

Selected Answer: B
I vote B, review the logs are key.

Seems the question is targeting the intranet and not the internet availability. As such, fuzzing the app server and database server may reveal why employees are being "locked-out". I've run into a similiar scenario where the problem was with the server's database scripting and not availability to the internet. 

This is the only possible reason I would have for accepting "fuzzing" as an answer.
how on earth could fuzzing be possibly be the next course of action? The analyst hasn't even looked at any logs to identify the cause of the slow response times!
The analyst is investigating an availability issue... meaning input....

Reviewing the syslog from critical servers is the correct answer not fuzzing. Fuzzing is a phase in SDLC that involves providing invalid, unexpected, or random data as inputs to a computer program.

ref: https://blog.rapid7.com/2017/05/24/what-is-syslog/
Fuzzing would be to test input validation. Syslog is a much better option here
Fuzzing is wrong, but is that what the test wants???
Is it fuzzing? Comptia's way of wording a question is so confusing.
Can anyone explain why Fuzzing is the answer to this?

questions.question_text:
A system is experiencing noticeably slow response times, and users are being locked out frequently. An analyst asked for the system security plan and found the system comprises two servers: an application server in the DMZ and a database server inside the trusted domain. Which of the following should be performed
NEXT to investigate the availability issue?

choices.D: Review logins to the laptop, search Windows Event Viewer, and review Wireshark captures.
choices.A: Delete the temporary files, run an Nmap scan, and utilize Burp Suite.
choices.C: Perform a hard power down of the laptop, take a dd image, and analyze with FTK.
choices.B: Disable the network connection, check Sysinternals Process Explorer, and review netstat output.

comments.content:
i think netstat output was already generated during the investigation process.

A and D are not ideal because it's clear that files are being downloaded off the network. Network traffic has to be cut off before anything else is done

discussion.content:
If I disable network connection, netstat is not going to show anything.
Anyways process were already verified as normal. I think should be A or D

questions.question_text:
Ann, a user, reports to the security team that her browser began redirecting her to random sites while using her Windows laptop. Ann further reports that the OS shows the C: drive is out of space despite having plenty of space recently. Ann claims she not downloaded anything. The security team obtains the laptop and begins to investigate, noting the following:
✑ File access auditing is turned off.
When clearing up disk space to make the laptop functional, files that appear to be cached web pages are immediately created in a temporary directory, filling
//IMG//
up the available drive space.
✑ All processes running appear to be legitimate processes for this user and machine.
✑ Network traffic spikes when the space is cleared on the laptop.
✑ No browser is open.
Which of the following initial actions and tools would provide the BEST approach to determining what is happening?
